modules.description: Provides functions to open, read, write, and manage files in O_DIRECT mode with page-aligned buffers, including direct I/O operations and file synchronization. Works with file descriptors and byte buffers to ensure data is written without caching. Used for high-performance disk operations, such as copying large files or writing raw data to storage devices.

Offers low-level file operations with O_DIRECT mode, enabling direct I/O to bypass system caching. It handles file descriptors and page-aligned byte buffers for efficient data transfer and synchronization. Operations include opening, reading, writing, and flushing files, ideal for tasks like raw disk writes or high-speed data copying. Examples include managing large file transfers or interfacing with block devices.

Provides functions for string manipulation, list transformations, and optional value handling. Works with strings, lists, and option types to simplify common data processing tasks. Used to clean and normalize input data before further processing in service workflows.

Provides low-level file manipulation with direct I/O support, using file descriptors and page-aligned buffers for efficient data handling. It enables operations such as opening, reading, writing, and flushing files, bypassing system caches for precise control. This is suitable for tasks like raw disk access or high-performance data transfers. Examples include copying large files without cache interference or interacting with block devices.
